newsitem.title: HONG KONG: RESEARCH ALERT - Merrill upgrades Sing Tao.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Merrill upgrades Sing Tao.

text.p: Merrill Lynch has upgraded its recommendation for Sing Tao Holdings Ltd to "accumulate" and raised its earnings forecast for the company.
But Sing Tao was rated neutral in the longer term, Merrill said in a report dated December 18.

Merrill Lynch analyst Cara Eio said the closure of the loss-making Chinese-language evening newspaper, the Sing Tao Evening Post, would increase net profits by HK$15 million in the financial year ended in March 1998.
Losses attributed to the evening paper are estimated at HK$50 million annually, Eio said.
Merrill forecast net income of HK$37.5 million for the year ended March 1997 and a revised HK$106.6 million for the year ended March 1998.
The company faced the double hit of poor local and overseas property advertisements, a chief source of revenue, in the last financial year, and is trading at close to the bottom, she said.

"Longer term, we believe market share in property advertisement may be lost to property sections of other daily newspapers and a greater use of the internet by property agents -- thus a Long Term Neutral rating," Eio said.
